creator: ddilario

title: Firefox stops working after 10-20 minutes
content:
I am a long time Firefox user, having moved to Firefox from Netscape in the late 2000s. I have been very happy, but this latest issue has really been frustrating.

I am on a Windows 10 PC, and using the lates Firefox. It loads fine and works fine for 10 minutes or so and then just stops working. I can access menus, but if I click on a link - whether from the current page or a bookmark - nothing happens. It will not connect any longer and I need to shut down and restart. I can open a new tab, but nothing will load in the new tab.

I have tried everything. If I load in safe mode to remove all extensions - same issue. I did a refresh - same issue. I uninstalled and reinstalled - same issue. I removed my antivirus program (Malwarebytes) - same issue. I uninstalled my VPN program (Windscribe) - same issue. I have been searching for solutions and tried a number oft things like disabling hardware acceleration - same issue. (I have reinstalled those programs as removing them did not fix the issue and it did work with them previously.)

Any thoughts on what else it could possible be?
creator: larry93

title: I'm getting mesage "Secure Connection Failed"
content:
Hello. I was reading Quora.com web site on my notebook in Firefox (110.0.1 64-bit) normally, then I got power outage. When electricity returned and I tried to open it again, browser didn't open it and I gave me message:

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.quora.com. PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR

Error code: PR_END_OF_FILE_ERROR 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem.

I've tried to get support from Quora.com how message said, but they told me "this error does not originate from our website". And gave me some suggestions - "The easiest way to fix this secure connection error is to reset the Firefox settings." I've performed "Refresh Firefox", but problem persists. I don't use VPN. Can anyone please help me with this problem?

title: fiefox
content:
Hallo zusammen, Firefox zeigt von gewünschten Webseiten Kacheln an. Wie kann man die Graphik der Kacheln durch benutzerdefinierte Graphik ersetzen? Unter bearbeiten wird angezeigt: „Benutzerdefinierte Graphik verwenden“ und „Eine Adresse eingeben oder einfügen“ Scheinbar sollte das gehen! aber, wenn man das versucht wird angezeigt: „Gültige Adresse erforderlich“ Geht bei mir nicht. Warum? Wie muss die Adresse genau aussehen? *.jpg, *.png? etc. Alles versucht. Bitte Beispiel! Ggf. Einstellungen? PC-Einstellungen? Meine Firefox-Version ist aktuell und 110.0.1. (64 Bit) 

             Was ist da los? Bitte um Ihre Hilfe          Klaus Stärk

title: How to remap Caps Lock on Firefox
content: Hi, on Windows I've remapped Caps Lock key as (left) Ctrl because both of my Ctrl keys are physically broken. This used to solve the problem in all programs, Firefox including, till Firefox stopped respecting Windows Registry entries. On Firefox I mostly have been using Caps Lock + X, Caps Lock + C and Caps Lock + V for text editing. Now these combinations trigger (random?) actions, like Save Page As, switch current active tab, View Bookmarks Sidebar, View Page Source, etc. This is so frustrating, such shortcuts can only be accessed via Virtual Keyboard.
creator: main.de.justice

title: Download speed slows significantly with Firefox
content: I have 40MPS dsl. My download speed significantly reduced (17-20MPS) with the latest 110.0.1 version. I traced the problem over the last week to Firefox. I thought I resolved it by deleting one of my 3 add-ons. Speed significantly increase after that. The next morning, it was slow again. I hibernate my computer over night. I closed Firefox and it speeded back up. I re-opened Firefox and the speed remains high so far, but 3-4 MPS slower than with Firefox closed. I do notice that Firefox is a very large memory hog. I also have a newer (6 months) laptop running Win11.
creator: pmtrebs

title: Firefox stops responding when I try to upload a single photo from Explorer to Ancestry's gallery
content: After the most recent FF update, I cannot upload photos from File Explorer to Ancestry.com gallery. I open a photo file to begin the upload process to Ancestry but my monitor goes grey, I cannot use the cursor or click on anything. A big blue circle goes around slowly so my only way out is Esc and it says Firefox is not responding and asks if I want to close the program which I do. I have retried uploading several times and each time it fails. I did a disk cleanup, a system clean up, cleared history, cache and cookies, troubleshooters; all of things+ that are recommended to fix the problem. Command prompt isn't something I use but if I have to, I will. I need get a fix for the not responding issue, otherwise I have to put my family tree on hold indefinitely. Thanks.
creator: lewyes

title: Having a webpage open on Wi-Fi causes consistent ping spikes.
content:
I've noticed that while on Wi-Fi, having Firefox open on any webpage will cause consistent ping spikes every 5 seconds, making online games unplayable.

I've tested this normally, tried disabling all extensions, and tried troubleshoot mode. Task manager does not show any changes with CPU/Memory/Disk/Network under Firefox's process when these ping spikes happen, but the issue goes away immediately every time after closing out Firefox.

The webpage and what you are doing on that webpage does not matter (like streaming YouTube), it even happens after visiting google.com. However, I'll rarely get lucky and this issue won't occur while Firefox is open.

Issue does not occur with other browsers. If there is any additional info that I should provide please let me know.
creator: y
